newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour govt to reform competition laws quickly.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour govt to reform competition laws quickly.

text.p: Britain's main opposition Labour Party said on Friday it would reform Britain's competition laws early in the life of a new government.
"There is now a widespread consensus that our competition laws and institutions are not working well," the party said in its business manifesto.

It said it would introduce a "prohibitive approach" to provide a strong deterrent against restrictive agreements and abuses of market power, and introduce more effective penalties against proven anti-competitive behaviour.

The party said that from 1998 it would progressively lift restrictions on the freedom of telephone companies such as British Telecommunications Plc and Cable and Wireless Plc to offer entertainment services over their networks.
In the utility industries it would promote competition where possible and more effective regulation where necessary.
"We want regulation which is fair both to consumers and shareholders and gives managers every incentive to innovate and improve efficiency," the party said.
